titlestmt.titleproper: Jean S. Wilson, Class of 1924 Papers, 1927-1993
titlestmt.subtitle: Finding Aid
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Madison White.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in NoteTab Pro. Encoded by Jasmine Jones. 2015-07-28

did.head: Collection Overview
did.abstract: Contains correspondence, brochures, photographs, and news clippings from the papers of Jean S. Wilson, Professor of History 1927-1968.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Jean S. Wilson was born in Duluth, Minnesota, in 1903 to Alexander Strachan and Agnes (Gibson) Wilson. She received her B.A. from Smith College in 1924 and then received her Ph.D. from the University of London in 1927. Wilson came to Smith as a member of the History faculty in the same year. Wilson's research centered largely on early seventeenth century English history, especially people's attitudes toward government reform in the era. In 1930, she won the Social Science Research Fellowship to return to the University of London for research. While at Smith, Wilson was a member of Phi Beta Kappa, the American Historical Association, the British Records Association, and the Conference on British Studies Committee. Wilson also taught as a traveling professor to Swarthmore College and to the University of Iowa. She was named the Sydenham Clark Parsons professor of History in 1963. She retired in 1968, living in Northampton until her death in 1993.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The collection contains the professional papers of Jean S. Wilson, including correspondence with students, professional photographs, and news clippings about her career. The collection also contains the papers of the Service Organization of Smith (SOS), which include budgets of the organization, correspondence and brochures from the organization they donated to, and internal correspondence.

accessrestrict.p: The records are open for research according to the regulations of the Smith College Archives without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. Permission to publish material from the documents must be requested from the Smith College Archives. Smith College owns copyright to any published material relating to college events and activities. Provenance and copyright ownership of other materials is unknown and researchers are responsible for determining any question of copyright.

prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Jean S. Wilson Papers, Box #1085.1, Smith College Archives.

acqinfo.p: The Jean S. Wilson papers were donated to the College Archives.
